page.title: 13RUGBY IN CARRICKFERGUS.
page.content: It is assumed that the Rugby Club was formed in 1865 by military personnel attached to the castle. In the period 1910 - 1912 they were one of the strongest Junior clubs in Ulster. In the l950's they had three teams but by l960 they were fielding 6 teams regularly and won the Towns'Cup twice. In l976 they started "Mini-Rugby" which involves boys under eleven making up a team of seven and using simple rugby rules. The Club's greatest success was in reaching the final of the Ulster Senior Cup in 1983. Changing facilities in the earlier days was one small hut with one shower, up to the present they have six changing areas with showers. A new club house was opened in 1971 and squash courts were added in 1977. The l985 valuation of their facilities is Â£250,000.
